caption: I've been going to this restaurant for years. This place is an old school gem with a lot of options.The food is always fresh and delicious. I'm grateful the pandemic didn't shut this place down.
Amazing food, hygienic and safe covid precautions, friendly staff. Great spot!!
Love this place.
Great pizza and pasta dishes. Sauce is amazing.
Amazing food, Amazing owner
A great place to eat, excellent pizza, tasty dishes, and friendly service.
The meal is consistently great and the family run restaurant is warm and inviting. Thank you 🇮🇹
ONE OF MY FAVORITE EATERIES AND GOOD PEOPLE

Awesome food. You won't be sorry. Dinner was delicious.

Best pizza in town. This place has never ever disappointed me. I love it. My friends and I went and we ate so good. They have gourmet pizza and a very good menu. Very clean, family friendly, gourmet food.
Never disappointing.. Vodka slice is amazing, along with everything else.

Ordered a few weeks ago , food came ice cold . Ordered again tonight (knowing the snow situation) and the woman told us 30minutes . Called after 45 minutes and checked on the status , we were told the driver wasn't back yet , it would be an additional 10-15 minutes (we are less than 1 mile away) . Called back again 40 mins later , the driver was still not back , so we canceled the order . The guy who answered the phone said "don't you see the snow" ... well if you can't meet an expectation , don't set one. And you shouldn't  hang up on your customers . This is south Brooklyn and there is a pizzeria on every other corner . The food is good but I won't be ordering from a place who can't treat their customers the right way and I'll make sure all of my friends and family know how La Casa Bella treats and talks to their customers ! Have a good night
(Translated by Google) Excellent if you want to try good food this is the best place.  (Original) Exelente si quieres probar una buena comida es el mejor lugar.
A great place by all people  that go there.
Love this place! Excellent........🤗❤️😋🤘👏
The best pizza ever!
Great fast, prompt service.....
The most underrated pizzeria in Brooklyn. I wish more people knew of them. Can easily beat any pizzerias near them.

Ordered a vodka pie for delivery girl over the phone told me 22.50$ for the pie waited 2hrs for it to get to me the delivery driver refused to bring it up to me and price was 30+ dollars driver told me to call the place and figure it out with them no one picked up i ended up refusing to pay for it absolutely ridiculous
As always GREAT!!!!!!!!  GREAT FOOD MARVELOUS PIZZA AND FAST SERVICE
still very good food good and very good proportions. Very family feel to it. Excellent!

This restaurant came highly recommended by a childhood friend and now my plumber. Gary my friend said they were reasonably priced and hospitable. Gary lives in the neighborhood and has been going here for years. If you are known by the owners you can find good service. Once again my olive complexioned ex husband and his Puerto Rican wife and I walked in about five pm on a Wednesday and we sat down at the table for fifteen minutes without one person approaching us. I got so angry that I asked one of the behind the counter workers where is the waitresses? Finally someone came to our seats without welcoming us in any way and we were immediately asked what do we want to drink. It seems that the drinks like the wines there are their profitable expensive part of the meals. We don't drink alcohol and just asked if we could have seltzer with lemon. But we first of all asked if the seltzer is free. The first waitress took our order of a rice ball and spaghetti and meatballs for Diane and for Tony he wanted a order of spaghetti and meatballs that on the menu was twelve dollars but he wanted one extra meatball. The first waitress said that an order of two extra meatballs is six dollars. So we thought just one should be three dollars extra. I had shrimp and ziti with vodka sauce which is twenty two dollars. The rice ball was three dollars. We ordered our meal with the first waitress who then made us order once again with a second waitress who we had the exact conversation with meatballs seltzer and everything. Now know that nobody gave us the dinner menu which everyone else who came into the restaurant got. We asked prices for the chalkboard specials and found out that the fried ravioli with dipping sauce was twenty one dollars for four ravioli. So we saw the specials didn't have prices on them or the waitresses conveniently didn't know the prices of them because you are told in the end of the meal when you get the bill. This place I learned very quickly didn't like it that we asked how much things were. A sign of a high nosed restaurant. And the funny part is that this neighborhood is zone one immediately flooded with high tide area so the houses are selling dirt cheap now. But still the high nosed attitude exists. Next Sandy storm they are homeless. This is not the best neighborhood in Bklyn. You can see the element after dark. Anyway the restaurant is used to their own customers who walk in get greeted with dinner menus and ask no questions about prices. When most of them live in the Mitchell llama coops across the street. How do they afford this place we don't know. We got our food and Diane ordered another rice ball because they made hers squashed in sauce so Tony ate hers. We were charged ten dollars for three Seltzer's and Tony's spaghetti and meatballs with just the one extra meatball which was twelve dollars on the paper menu on the table because we didn't get the leather dinner menu cost Tony twenty one dollars. We didn't argue. We gave for the one hundred and twenty dollars meals a ten dollars tip. The service was horrible. If you are known there you find good service and a welcome. If you don't drink alcohol expect to be gouged with other drinks. Ten dollars for seltzer water that we would not have bought if we knew it cost ten dollars. For three glasses and this was from the fountain tap water. Which is free practically to the restaurant. Gary never got this attitude from the owners because he's a friend of theirs. Expect to be gouged if you ask prices. Don't go here is you are not known to them. I've learned that local restaurants do this too often. We were robbed but we know never to go back. I hope they get flooded. For the few reviews that got on the list recently, they are known customers and as for the one takeout customer that says to each her own, you were served by the spanish behind the counter workers and not the owners or the pretentious waitresses. Wait until you eat in the place and get service. It's a whole different thing than a to go pizza. We bought real food there. Not a pizza but a meal.
Everything is good to eat 30 years never got a bad dish
The food is Amazing!!!❤❤The service was good too!

Always a great pie. The vodka pie is to die for. Get it well done. I drive from staten island just to pick it up. Been going there since i was a child still my fav. Family owned and family friendly. Im second gen eating there my son is 3rd gen and its his fav also.

I can't tell you in words but go there. You won't be disappointed. But to each his/her own. Unfortunately you can't eat in any more right now. But you can go a couple of blocks down to the waters edge by the bay plaza looking over the water and eat in your car. Very cozy 🥰 Unlike the 2 dummy's next to us smoking a bong. I'll guess I'll give them the menu to the pizzaria for when the munchies hit.😂🤣😂🤣

I hate when they say "2 minutes". Becouse after 15 mins thru asked me "what did you order?" I  ordered and paid online! I'm on for 20 mins prepare, but not waiting 20 mins with all family and small kids in car while they told me 2 minutes. I live 2 blocks away, 20mins it's a lot, I can drop off my family and parking twice! But for now I still waiting my 3 slice pizza, 21mins passed already.

As soon as I walked in I had horrible feeling about this place. What an Unprofessional place this is. Everyone is screaming at each other. No one knows what the heck is going on. Mad House!

This place it’s been our favorite restaurant for a long time now. My wife and i have tried almost all the dishes and every single one is absolutely delicious, we love the food, the pizza, the atmosphere, the price the workers. We love everything about this place!!!

I ordered my food at 1pm to be delivered at 530. I know its mothers day and they are very busy. However the unprofessionalism is disgraceful. I call at 540 and they tell me my food is on the way. I call back at 630 and they say they are sorry but it won't be leaving the restuarant for another 20 minutes. Ok fine no problem. My food just arrived at 900pm. Mind you all this time we are calling and there is no answer. They had no problem taking the money from my card though when I placed the order. Never again and not worth the wait either. It's a shame.

The WORST Experience ever. I have never seen an establishment that was ran so unprofessional. I walked in with my son, everyone is running around like a mad house no one came over. I was not sure if you sit down or wait to be seated. Many times they looked over to us and nothing was said. The Big Moma looks like she running the show, and she just keeps walking passed on, other girls also running around and nothing. I just told my son go order at the counter. I just left and waiting outside. Too bad only Pizza in the Neighborhood. Place is too loud. Everyone screaming at each other. No organization. You don't get that welcome feeling when you come inside.

Food was okay for a pizza place. Hostess was nasty. She got mad when I asked her for a few glasses of water. She tried to bring me Aquafina and say I can’t order glasses of water if I’m not ordering from a waitress. In fact, I did order parms from the waitress but, we did have a few slices of pizza from the counter. The way she then brought the waters turned me off and I didn’t even drink them. Toilet water? No thanks. On top of that we were the only table with minorities so, that may have been part of the reason. 3 stars because the food is ok but, the service is mediocre at best. You are better off going to L and B and that’s where I’m going to probably go from now. Oh and btw, all the other people got bread and butter with glasses of water with their meal. GREAT FOOD. Always courteous & friendly

This place is a perfect example of how service suffers when a business gets busy. I’ve been going there for about 15 years and I can’t remember how many people my husband and I have brought with us to eat there. Many of my friends go back on their own and some are now regulars there. A couple of years ago we went there for dinner and brought one of my friends/coworkers with us. We raved about the food there. We work in the city and now live on Staten Island so The restaurant is really not on our way. I had a terrible experience that day. The waitress made a mistake on both my husband and friend’s orders and instead of just apologizing and fixing it she gave us an attitude and went behind the counter to complain to the guys who make the pizza. It was loud enough for me to hear it otherwise I wouldn’t know. She said that that’s how the food comes and that I didn’t ask for it the way I wanted it, and as I explained that I was going there for so long her response to me was “well I’m friends with the owners.” Really not called for. I went back a few days later  to the owner and complained and his response to me was well she works every other Thursday so just avoid coming here on her days. REALLY!!! We continued to go there because we like the food and managed to somehow not deal with her again. Last Thursday we were there with a couple of our friends and gave her our orders, she obviously forgot them because she came back to confirm what they were, even after we watched her write them down. She repeated the other 3 people’s orders and then I told her what mine was. I ordered a penne chicken vodka (this is how it is listed on the menu). The food came out and I had no chicken in my plate so I nicely said mine was with chicken. She turned her face to me gave me pretty much a death stare and said I repeated it. Um no she did not repeat it and the proof is she couldn’t remember what it was 5 minutes after we ordered. She said she would remake it and I said ok. She walked to the back where the kitchen is and was whining about what happened to another employee so I walked up to the owner and said do you remember what happened a couple of years ago and he said it’s ok I’ll make it for you! My friends saw her say loudly “really, really” then She came running to the counter and kept saying she  apologized and said she would make it. No, I did not get an apology, neither did I really care for one. Once again lady I don’t care, I just wanted my right dish and no attitude. While we were sitting there I also watched her argue with another customer at the counter while the owner watched. I’m not sure about anyone else but I run a business myself, and I don’t care if my own mother worked there, I would not let here be rude to my customers and just stand and watch. I would at the very least apologize and speak to my employee about her attitude. No, I’m not going back and I’m sure they don’t need my business, they might have needed it 15 years ago but I’m sure they don’t today, but if they keep this up they’re going to lose a lot of people’s business. Good food, Service and word of mouth is how people go back to a business, and I am one for sure not saying anything good about them from now on. I guess my advice is: Don’t go there on Thursdays, and avoid at any cost dealing with the short blonde with an attitude.
Great service

Pizza Crust Good....Pizza Sauce WAY...TOO...SWEET  could not finish second slice.  Left it on table.  Almost nacious. Mentioned  it to owner ( an older Skinny Blonde with a frown on her face ) It was not well received. Gotta lose the attitude lady. Never goin back there...

Great place too eat...

I went there a few times 2 years ago and it was excellent. This time the marinara sauce tasted like they mixed in a whole cup of sugar(ok for some sugar but NOT that much).  Place is bustling. I recommend going when it's cool/cold outside because the oven is about 40 feet from the tables and even with a/c on it gets hot in there.  The food for the most part is good. They get so busy that they gave me and my friend each other's food to take home. They also gave me the wrong change. This was just my experience this one time. I'm sure it will be better next time.  Place is clean, clean bathroom and fresh food.  Order their rice balls. They're great!
The food is Excellent! The Pizza and Dishes are home made Italian Style!

Our usual Italian spot. This is a family owned restaurant, everyone there is very nice. Don't miss out their free bread, so good! And their dishes are so yummy too!
Good food, good service. I recommend portabello mushroom appetizers, buratta appetizer, any of the chicken entrees, steak entree with garlic butter is great as well.

Firstly, I have been coming here since the 90's. This has been a staple in the neighborhood. The vodka slices and the brick oven pizza is a must have. Dinner here as always been top notch. We've been stopping in regularly for pizza and dinners randomly or for special occasions.
I love everything on the menu

My first time there and went there with with family with a 45 minute notification of change of reservation from a party of 20 to party of 40.  Jessica and Taylor who both served our party was MAGNIFICENT!!  They went above and beyond to make sure our party was well accommodated, 7 under 10 kids, as well as having to take care of their normal lunch services.  Their food was great, no complaints from anyone, and we basically got everything on the menu.  Food came out a little slow, but definitely not their fault with having to deal with normal lunch, takeouts and 20 appetizers and 40+ entrees.

A neighborhood staple! I’ve been coming to this pizzeria/ restaurant since I was a little girl. Now I regularly come to Casa Bella to celebrate, birthdays, graduations and everyday dinners! Their food is always delicious and is always on time to be delivered or picked up. I’m so happy I get to share this tradition with my own daughter now.
This place has good grandma pies. Very under the radar. Sauce and fresh cheese is what makes the pizza good.

This place is just great!  The food is always fresh and the servers are pleasant. One of the owners Rose, is just a sweetheart.
